entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 1:46PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Rising Water Levels on Rivers Draining the Brooks Range... Several weather fronts moving across the eastern Brooks Range will bring rising water levels to rivers and streams. Additional rainfall totals from 0.50 to 1.00 inches are possible through Friday. Some isolated locations could see higher amounts. Water levels are expected to remain within bank and below flood stage.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 8:16AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...MENDENHALL LAKE AND RIVER LEVELS REMAIN HIGH... Water levels along the Mendenhall Lake and River in Juneau remain elevated and near bankfull due to previous days heavy rainfall. River levels are expected to drop late Thursday evening as no more heavy precipitation is forecast for the region. People living along the lake and river and any individuals recreating on these water
entry.cap:areaDesc: Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 4:25AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...PERIODS OF RAINFALL WILL CONTINUE ACROSS SOUTHCENTRAL THROUGH SATURDAY... Additional storm systems will move across Southcentral Alaska through the first half of the weekend. Widespread rain is expected Thursday evening through Friday morning, and again Friday evening into Saturday morning.
